verses.roman:
dāruko dvārakām etya
vasudevograsenayoḥ
patitvā caraṇāv asrair
nyaṣiñcat kṛṣṇa-vicyutaḥ

synonyms: dārukaḥ—Dāruka; dvārakām—in Dvārakā; etya—arriving; vasudeva-ugrasenayoḥ—of Vasudeva and Ugrasena; patitvā—falling down; caraṇau—at the feet; asraiḥ—with his tears; nyaṣiñcat—drenched; kṛṣṇa-vicyutaḥ—deprived of Lord Kṛṣṇa.
translation: As soon as Dāruka reached Dvārakā, he threw himself at the feet of Vasudeva and Ugrasena and drenched their feet with his tears, lamenting the loss of Lord Kṛṣṇa.
